alert.note: Alert for Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 3:37AM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...In New York, Southeastern St. Lawrence, Southern Franklin, Western Clinton, and Eastern Essex Counties. In Vermont, Washington and Orange Counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM This Evening to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures above freezing may initially limit accumulations to grassy, elevated surfaces Monday evening. Snow may be briefly heavy, which may lead to localized power outages, with the most likely region being higher elevations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
